smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams found. All 19 pages contain diagrams with at least one element. Examples: Page 1 has package diagram with multiple packages and actors, Page 2 has use case diagram with 4 use cases and 5 actors, etc.

On page 2 (Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem - Vaata & Tuvasta), the use case oval 'Tuvasta kasutaja' has ZERO actor associations. While other use cases (Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet) are connected to actors (Uudistaja, Klienditeenindaja, Juhataja, Klient, Autode haldur), 'Tuvasta kasutaja' is only shown within the system boundary with no actor connection line.

No duplicate use case names with same activities for same actors found. All use cases have unique activity names: Page 2 has 4 distinct use cases (Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet). Page 3 has 7 distinct use cases (Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto).

No duplicate element names within same package found. All elements within packages have unique names. For example, in Klassifikaatorite register (page 15), all tables have unique names: Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Auto_kytuse_liik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark.

No redundant data columns without FK relationships found. Common columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple classifier tables but represent different classification contexts (Auto_kategooria, Riik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, etc.) - this is not redundancy per rule definition. All actual data relationships are connected via FK constraints.

Consistent naming form used in all use cases. All use cases start with active verbs: 'Tuvasta' (Identify), 'Vaata' (View), 'Registreeri' (Register), 'Lõpeta' (End), 'Muuda' (Modify), 'Aktiveeri' (Activate), 'Unusta' (Forget). No noun-first naming patterns found.

On page 9 (Auto seisundidiagramm), all 5 states are reachable: Ootel receives transition from Algus (start), Aktiivne receives from Ootel and Mitteaktiivne, Mitteaktiivne receives from Aktiivne, Lõpetatud receives from Aktiivne and Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud receives from Ootel. Every state has at least one incoming transition.

On page 4 (Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm), all 4 actions are reachable from start node: 'Vaata kõiki autosid, mida saab lõpetada' directly from Algus, 'Otsi autot' via decision, 'Vali auto' via flow, 'Lõpeta valitud auto' via flow. All actions have incoming flows from the start node path.

All relationships have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 14 (Isikute register) - Isik to Kasutajakonto shows 1 to 0..1; Page 17 (Autode register) - Auto to Auto_kategooria_omamine shows 1 to 0..*; Page 19 (Tootajate register) - Tootaja to Tootaja_rolli_omamine shows 1 to 0..*. Every relationship examined has complete multiplicity.

No diagram has ≥10 central elements. Counts: Page 2 = 4 use cases, Page 3 = 7 use cases, Page 5 = 3 classes, Page 6 = 6 classes, Page 7 = 6 classes, Page 8 = 6 classes, Page 9 = 5 states, Page 10 = 5 classes, Page 11 = 3 classes, Page 12 = 7 classes, Page 13 = 3 classes, Page 14 = 4 tables, Page 15 = 9 tables, Page 16 = 3 tables, Page 17 = 6 tables, Page 18 = 2 tables, Page 19 = 5 tables. Maximum is 9 (Page 15). Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

No single element has ≥6 visual connection lines. Counted on each database diagram page: Page 14 - Isik has 3 lines (to Kasutajakonto, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Riik); Page 17 - Auto has 5 lines (to Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_seisundi_liik, plus one more); Page 19 - Tootaja has 4 lines. Maximum count = 5 on any element. Threshold is ≥6. Since 5 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of all diagrams shows reasonably compact layouts. Related elements are positioned near each other without excessive distances. No relationship distance appears to exceed twice the average element distance on any diagram.

All use cases and actions start with active verbs. Page 2: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View). Page 3: Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Modify), Aktiveeri (Activate), Vaata (View), Unusta (Forget). Page 4 actions: Vaata, Otsi (Search), Vali (Select), Lõpeta. All names begin with imperative verb forms.

The attribute 'vin' in the Auto table (pages 11, 12, 17, 18) has exactly 3 characters. Threshold is ≤3 characters. 'vin' = 3 chars, and 3 ≤ 3, therefore smell IS present. This attribute represents Vehicle Identification Number but uses a very short abbreviation.

All class names start with uppercase and are singular. Examples: Isik (not Isikud), Auto (not Autod), Töötaja (not Töötajad), Klient (not Kliendid), Klassifikaator, Kasutajakonto, Riik. No lowercase starting letters or plural forms found.

All attribute/column names start with lowercase. Examples from Auto table: auto_kood, nimetus, mudel, valjalaske_aasta, reg_number, istekohtade_arv, mootori_maht, vin, reg_aeg. Examples from Isik table: isik_id, isikukood, e_meil, synni_kp, eesnimi, perenimi. No uppercase starting letters found.

All database table names are singular. Tables: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Riik, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Klient, Auto, Tootaja, Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Auto_mark, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_omamine, Tootaja_rolli_omamine. No plural forms (like 'Autod', 'Isikud', 'Kliendid') found.

No type prefixes found in class, table, or attribute names. Examined all elements for prefixes like 'tbl_', 'uc_', 'str', 'int', etc. The PK_, FK_, pfK, and IXFK_ prefixes present in the database diagrams are explicitly allowed per rule definition. No prohibited type prefixes detected.
